thread.title: Calls for NT WorkSafe boss to go after 'failure to investigate' deaths
thread.title_full: Calls for NT WorkSafe boss to go after 'failure to investigate' deaths

author: Avani Dias
title: Calls for NT WorkSafe boss to go after 'failure to investigate' deaths
text:
Map: Darwin 0800 
Northern Territory union members have rallied against NT WorkSafe, calling for the immediate resignation of its head, after a spate of accidents, including the death of a sailor last month. 
"We feel that there's been too many instances of failure and the honesty of the head of NT WorkSafe is questionable," the Maritime Union's Thomas Mayor said. 
A 37-year-old man died after falling from a barge at Hudson Creek wharf in Darwin on January 7. 
He was living on the vessel and working with Top End company Barge Express. 
Mr Mayor said the incident was an example of NT WorkSafe's failure to investigate thoroughly and prosecute employers. 
"The death was at Hudson Creek, a place that we've raised concern with NT WorkSafe in the past and the same place where an employer was dishonest to NT WorkSafe when they didn't act, and now we have a death there," he said. 
"We think that if NT WorkSafe had acted, this death would not have happened." 
Mr Mayor said access to the barge was unsafe and should have been fixed after an inspection by NT WorkSafe. 
The Maritime Union has been calling for appropriate infrastructure to be used at the Hudson Creek Wharf since part of it collapsed in 2014.
